qas.question: Who is king of God's kingdom in heaven?
What do Jehovah Witnesses remain politically?
What are Jehovah Witnesses discouraged from doing?
Why do Jehovah Witnesses forego religious holidays and birthdays or other celebrations?

answers.text: they consider to honor people other than Jesus

qas.question: What do Jehovah Witnesses feel all the traditional holidays reflect?
What Protestant group encourages their members to celebrate Easter?
What Protestant religion encourages members to vote in elections?
What is one of the Protestant religions that thinks it's fun to celebrate their kid's birthdays?
What is one of the Protestant religions that thinks celebrating things other than Jesus are ok?
What is one of the Protestant religions that enjoys celebrating Christmas with one another?

context: <b5_0><b6_0><b7_0><b8_0><b9_0>Jehovah's Witnesses<b9_0/><b8_0/><b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/> believe their highest allegiance belongs to God's kingdom, which is viewed as an actual government in heaven, with <a0_0>Christ<a0_0/> as king. They remain politically <a1_0>neutral<a1_0/>, do not seek public office, and are discouraged from <a2_0>voting<a2_0/>, though individual members may participate in uncontroversial community improvement issues. Although they do not take part in politics, they respect the authority of the governments under which they live. They do not celebrate religious holidays such as Christmas and Easter, nor do they observe birthdays, nationalistic holidays, or other celebrations <a3_0>they consider to honor people other than Jesus<a3_0/>. They feel that these and many other customs have pagan origins or reflect a nationalistic or political spirit. Their position is that these traditional holidays reflect <a4_0>Satan's control over the world<a4_0/>. Witnesses are told that spontaneous giving at other times can help their children to not feel deprived of birthdays or other celebrations.
